reviewText: Powerful, informative and entertaining!!!  Very well done!!!!
Wonderful film with an American Classic actress's and husband Ossie Davis
Haven't looked at the video.  But, it arrived in good condition.  I am pleased with my purchase.
Love this story. Very enlightening. I'm not one for documentaries, but this was great and held my attention the entire time
A beautiful Love Story that is real and genuine.
What a great documentary my family and I learned so much from it

This documentary was simply Amazing! A job well done! I was so moved from watching this, that I became inspired to interview my Grandmother on camera to seek answers regarding our family history, and to help me along my own journey to become a better person. Ruby Dee and Ossie Davis were simply, black royalty. As a person that grew up heavily engaged into theater arts, I have always admired Ruby Dee for her art, her activism, and what she stood for. The love story aspect of the documentary was very captivating, needless to say, I believe we all want that Ruby Dee - Ossie Davis type of Love.

A wise man leaves an inheritance for his children's children (Proverbs). In this film documentary a grandson explores a legacy of experience and wisdom left for him by his activist/celebrity grandparents--based on their own oral history and testimony. Wonderfully researched and told. What interesting lives they lived together--what a legacy for their grandchildren who remain on earth to share.

Yes, I loved it, and my family loved it.  I should say "loves" it, because we all have watched it several times over.  It is about the best documentary I have ever seen.  I did not know Ruby Dee and Ossie Davis were so active in the civil rights movement.  They used their celebrity status to reach far more powerful people than the average protester could reach.  The famous were making statements for the poor!  I love every bit of the stories told by their grandson, and I am so happy he saw fit to honor his grandparents in such a royal style.
